meanings.definition: A soft mixture of lime with sand or cement and water for spreading on walls, ceilings, or other structures to form a smooth hard surface when dried.
meanings.sent1: The plaster on the wall made it look smooth and clean.
meanings.sent2: The workers applied plaster to the ceiling to make it even.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat left paw prints in the wet plaster on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a fresh coat of plaster, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully sculpted the wet plaster into a beautiful design.

meanings.definition: A bandage or strip of adhesive tape used for covering cuts or wounds.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, the nurse applied a plaster to the wound.
meanings.sent2: She always keeps a few plasters in her first aid kit.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special power was healing wounds with magical plasters.
meanings.sent4: The bandage acted like a protective plaster, shielding the injury.
meanings.sent5: The colorful plaster made the injury less scary for the child.

meanings.definition: To cover or coat with plaster.
meanings.sent1: They decided to plaster the old brick wall for a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: The workers will plaster the new house next week.
meanings.sent3: He tried to plaster a smile on his face despite feeling sad.
meanings.sent4: The news of her promotion seemed to plaster a grin on his face.
meanings.sent5: She plastered the poster on the wall to decorate her room.

meanings.definition: A hard white substance made by heating limestone.
meanings.sent1: The sculptor used plaster to create a beautiful statue.
meanings.sent2: The ancient building was constructed using blocks of plaster.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand was made of a mysterious type of plaster.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight reflected off the smooth surface of the plaster.
meanings.sent5: The scientist discovered a new way to strengthen plaster for buildings.
